summary: Pullups Tracker: fully offline, ultra-premium pull-up tracking app with wheel-only input, elite futuristic UI, deep analytics, animated dashboard/graphs, metallic hex rank system, SFX+haptics, optional manual Google Drive backup/restore, plus advanced offline intelligence layers (prediction, readiness/fatigue, milestones, insights, psychological feedback) and an offline coins + probabilistic chest shop system with premium animations and card wallet.
architectural_notes: App must be fully offline-first; never require internet for core functionality.
Persist all workout data in a local database; support unlimited lifetime records.
No keyboard/text input anywhere; all numeric input via vertical wheel pickers; notes via predefined selectable tags only.
Optional manual Google Drive backup/restore only (not required for operation).
UI style: elite futuristic minimal cold aesthetic with glassmorphism, soft shadows, depth layers, icon-based navigation.
Extensive animations: counters rolling, hex shine, graph draw, blur transitions, orb fill, streak flame, rank promo explosion, button depth presses.
Audio: sound effects only (no music) with specified events; integrate with haptic feedback tiers.
Performance requirement: extremely smooth/instant response; prioritize animation and scrolling fluidity.
Color palette must follow provided hex values for backgrounds, accents, ranks, text, status colors, wheel picker.
Volume control must be the stickman pull-up interaction (no static slider), including physics, arm stretch, gravity drop, vibration.
known_issues: Reported interaction/animation/selector issues: stickman volume control currently too static and wheel selector centering/spacing not correct (selected value touching lines / not centered).

existing_features.title: Implement a fully offline-first data layer that stores all pull-up logs locally on the device (no internet required for core functionality) and supports unlimited lifetime data.

Add manual backup and restore via a user-initiated export/import flow that can be stored in Google Drive by the user (no automatic sync required): export all local data to a single file and restore from that file, with clear success/failure states.

Enforce a strict 'no keyboard anywhere' UX: remove/avoid all freeform text inputs and numeric typing. All numeric values (sets, reps, duration, weight, any number) must be chosen via a vertical wheel picker with inertia, snapping, center highlight glow, and tick sound feedback; notes must be selectable predefined tags only.
Create the core app navigation and screens: Dashboard, Log, History, Analytics, Settings, with icon-based minimal navigation and smooth transitions between screens (blur/depth animation).

Dashboard: show today's total pullups as a large animated rolling counter; show current rank as an animated metallic hexagon badge; show streak flame animation; show fatigue indicator ring; show an orb-style energy core that fills as the user progresses toward a goal; apply subtle animated gradient background with depth blur.

Log Screen: implement a premium logging flow using wheel pickers to select number of sets and reps per set, with optional duration and optional weight; include predefined tags for notes; on save, persist the session, play a premium confirmation sound, trigger haptics, and show a pulse confirmation animation.

History Screen: display the last 365 days of pull-up totals in a smooth animated graph that draws left-to-right on open; allow tapping a day to view details; show weekly average, monthly total, and personal records derived from the stored data.

Analytics Screen: compute and display max pullups ever, current streak, longest streak, daily average, fatigue score, consistency score, and rank progress based on local data; include a personal record celebration (visual + SFX + haptic) when a new record is achieved.

Rank system: implement the full rank ladder (Bronze III → Ascendant) with animated metallic hexagon badges including metal texture, inner glow, moving shine reflection, particle aura, and a promotion animation (explosion/impact). Rank progress must update based on the user’s accumulated performance and be visible on Dashboard and Analytics.

Sound effects system (no music): add and wire SFX for button click, wheel tick, data save chime, rank promotion impact, streak ignition flame, metal touch, and deep bass pulse on personal record; provide a global volume control that affects all SFX.

Settings: implement an interactive stickman pull-up volume control (no static slider) where the user drags a stickman upward on a pull-up bar to increase volume; reaching 100% triggers an automatic drop and resets volume to 0, with physics-like animation (arm stretch, gravity drop) and a special vibration at max pull; also include Reset Data with a premium confirmation animation.

Apply the specified luxury visual system across the entire app (glass morphism, soft shadows, depth layers, minimal cold futuristic feel) using the exact provided color palette for backgrounds, cards, accents, buttons, wheel picker, text, and rank colors; ensure the UI feels 'alive' with pervasive motion and responsive micro-interactions.

Implement haptic feedback patterns using the platform vibration capability where available: light vibration on button press, medium on save, strong on rank promotion, and special vibration on volume max pull; ensure the app degrades gracefully when vibration is unsupported.

Ensure performance and smoothness: animations and interactions (wheel inertia, counters, graph drawing, transitions) must remain responsive with no noticeable lag on typical mobile devices; avoid unnecessary network requests and heavy rerenders.

Replace the current Settings "StickmanVolumeControl" with a fully interactive, animated stickman pull-up volume controller: a fixed/anchored pull-up bar at the top (bar never moves), a moving stickman attached to the bar, and a right-side vertical volume slider that drives the stickman’s pull-up/reverse-pull-up motion.

Implement the right-side vertical volume slider UI with the exact specified luxury glassmorphism styling: width 64dp, rounded corners 32dp, background gradient #1f2937 → #111827, and a border glow color #22c55e. The slider must only move its knob/handle and must not drag the page.

Make the slider-driven volume change discrete and pull-up-based: sliding UP triggers pull-up animations and increases volume by exactly +2% per completed pull-up; sliding DOWN triggers reverse pull-up animations and decreases volume by exactly −2% per completed pull-up.

Implement the full pull-up motion sequence and timing for each pull-up cycle: arms bend, body rises, chin reaches the bar, slight pause of 0.2 seconds at the top, then lowering smoothly. Each pull-up cycle duration must be 0.8 seconds and use cubic-bezier(0.4,0,0.2,1). Add subtle body swing physics, slight leg motion, and a grip tightening animation.

Upgrade stickman visuals: render the stickman with stroke color #e5e7eb and stroke width 4dp; add a glow effect when volume is above 80% (glow color #22c55e with blur radius 12dp). When idle (no slider interaction), animate breathing with a subtle up/down movement of 4dp every 2 seconds.
Add sweat particle effects when volume is above 70%: emit small fading circles with color #22c55e and opacity 0.4 near/around the stickman during exertion (pull-up motion).

Add interaction feedback for the new volume controller: trigger haptic feedback on each completed pull-up; play a short click sound "tick_soft.wav" at 15% volume on each completed pull-up; lock page scroll while interacting with the slider to prevent dragging conflicts.
Add a volume percentage label above the stickman that updates with an animated counting effect and transitions color from #9ca3af to #22c55e as the volume increases.

Fix and upgrade the WheelPicker number selector UI so the selected number is perfectly centered between two thin horizontal lines (not touching). Implement a 3-row visible wheel where the center row is always the selected value, with equal spacing above and below to visually isolate the center value.

Apply the exact WheelPicker typography/color styling: center (selected) value uses size 28sp, bold, color #22c55e; non-selected values use size 18sp, color #6b7280 with opacity 0.6. Horizontal lines use color #374151 with thickness 2dp.

Improve WheelPicker physics and animation: add smooth inertia scrolling with snap-to-center behavior and scroll resistance physics; add subtle scale animation where the center number scales to 1.15 and the others scale to 0.9; ensure wheel input only (no keyboard) and prevent page dragging conflicts during wheel interaction.

Ensure the upgraded volume controller and WheelPicker interactions/animations remain premium and performant: target smooth 60fps animation, use hardware-accelerated transforms where applicable, and remove any interaction conflicts that cause page dragging while the slider/wheel is active.

Implement an offline-only Adaptive Strength Intelligence Engine that analyzes the entire pull-up history to compute (a) strength trend, (b) momentum, and (c) future potential, and produces predicted max pull-ups for 7, 30, and 90 days along with a confidence percentage for each horizon.

Add a Readiness Score system that calculates a daily readiness score based on last training sessions, streak intensity, existing fatigue score, and inferred recovery time, and display it as an animated circular meter with status labels: "Peak", "Ready", "Moderate", "Fatigued", "Critical" plus a recommendation text: "Train heavy", "Train light", or "Rest".

Separate fatigue and recovery into two distinct metrics—Muscular Fatigue and Nervous System Load—each with different recovery/decay behavior (nervous system load increases after high-intensity sessions and decreases slowly over time; muscular fatigue recovers faster), and render them as two visually distinct animated glowing ring meters.

Add Session Quality scoring: after every saved session, compute a quality score from 0–100 based on consistency, improvement, and fatigue, then show an elite result presentation (smooth number animation + sound effect) and persist the quality score history offline.

Implement an offline Milestone Intelligence system that detects and celebrates milestones including: first 10 reps, first 100 total reps, best streaks, and unusual improvements; display an elite popup animation upon detection and store a milestone timeline offline.

Add Performance Pattern Detection that analyzes historical offline data to identify insights including best training time of day, best rest duration, and most effective training frequency, and display these as elite intelligence messages within the Analytics screen.
Add a Lifetime Strength Curve Graph separate from the existing 365-day history graph, showing maximum strength progression trend across the entire lifetime dataset with smooth animated rendering.

Add a Consistency Intelligence Score (discipline score) calculated from streak stability, missed days, and recovery balance, and display it as an animated percentage with a short English explanation of what it represents.

Implement a Psychological Pressure system: when the user misses too many days, trigger subtle urgency feedback including a fading streak flame visual, a dimming orb energy visual, and a soft low-tone sound via the existing SFX system.

Add Elite Focus Mode to the Log flow: while logging sets/reps (wheel input phase), the background dims, distractions/navigation are visually suppressed, and only the pull-up input interface remains prominent; play a deep ambient pulse sound effect during focus mode while preserving the strict no-keyboard UX.

Add an Advanced Statistics screen that includes: total lifetime reps, total sessions, average reps per session, most productive week, fastest improvement period, and current strength velocity; integrate it into the existing navigation in a way that does not remove or rebuild existing screens.

Add micro-progress tracking, adaptive orb upgrade, and elite startup sequence: (a) the smallest improvements (e.g., +1 rep) trigger subtle positive feedback animation and sound; (b) the Dashboard orb reflects both daily progress and long-term strength evolution by varying intensity/glow size/pulse speed based on performance trend; (c) on app open, play an elite startup sequence where the hexagon rank appears first, then the orb activates, then the Dashboard content loads smoothly.

Upgrade the existing RankBadge visual design to the specified elite ultra‑premium 3D floating hexagon style without changing rank tier logic, thresholds, or promotion rules. Apply the provided geometry, sizing, layering, shadows, aura, and animations: perfect geometric hexagon; default size 240px; double-layer outline (3px inner solid + outer blurred glow at 40% opacity); subtle inner gradient fill (top: rank color 18% opacity, bottom: darker rank color 8% opacity, center mostly dark); inset shadow (rgba(0,0,0,0.6) blur 25px offset 0 6px); external shadow (rgba(0,0,0,0.8) blur 40px offset 0 15px); ambient aura behind hexagon (radial glow circle 340px, 20% opacity, blur 60px, colored by rank aura/primary); animated energy pulse (outline glow brightness 60%↔100% over 2.8s ease-in-out); breathing scale (1.00↔1.035 over 4s ease-in-out); holographic micro reflection diagonal sweep layer (8% opacity, 5s infinite). Ensure the badge no longer looks flat and reads as a physical glowing object floating in space.

Update the center rank symbol inside the hexagon to match the specification: perfectly centered text; font Orbitron Bold or Exo 2 Bold; size 42px; pure white (#ffffff) with text glow using the current rank color (blur 12px, ~80% opacity). Ensure the center remains mostly dark to preserve the luxury look.

Implement RankBadge touch interaction feedback: on tap/click, instantly increase perceived brightness to ~140% and scale to 1.08, then smoothly return to normal within 400ms. Play a soft energy pulse sound on tap using the existing SFX system.

Upgrade the rank promotion animation visuals (RankPromotionOverlay + embedded RankBadge behavior during promotion) to match the new elite style: when rank increases, the hexagon expands to 1.25 scale, performs a strong glow flash, and the aura expands outward, then settles back; total duration ~900ms. Play the elite rank-up sound via the existing SFX system and keep existing haptics behavior intact.

Apply the user-specified rank color system for the upgraded badge visuals: Bronze primary #ff8c42 aura #ffb37a; Silver primary #cfd8dc aura #ffffff; Gold primary #ffd700 aura #fff3b0; Platinum primary #00e5ff aura #6ff9ff; Diamond primary #7c4dff aura #b388ff; Master primary #00ff95 aura #7dffc1. Map existing app rank tiers (e.g., Bronze I/II/III, Silver I/II/III, etc.) onto these groups without changing tier names or thresholds. Use the deep radial background gradient behind the badge (center #0d1117, edges #000000) where the badge is presented prominently.

Create an offline Achievements system containing exactly 50 achievements as provided by the user (names + trophy symbol concepts), categorized into difficulty filters (easy, medium, hard, legendary). Each achievement must have a unique trophy symbol (SVG/canvas/vector is acceptable) reflecting the specified concept (bar, clipboard, stopwatch, flames, fists, medals, shield, target, sun, warning, eye, mountain, flag, arrows, diamond, crown, spark, calendar, etc.).

Persist achievements locally (offline-first) including unlock state and timestamps. Extend the existing IndexedDB layer (frontend/src/lib/offlineDb.ts) to store achievement definitions/unlock records and to include achievements in export/import backups. Ensure the existing backup/restore flow continues to work and now includes achievements data.

Implement achievement unlock detection that evaluates existing offline data and events (e.g., when a session is saved in LogScreen, when milestones are detected, when session quality is computed, streak changes, orb fill events, readiness/fatigue thresholds, micro-progress events, prediction accuracy events, and other listed categories). Unlock the appropriate achievements based on the user-provided list intent (pull-up totals, streaks, consistency, session quality, milestones, orb energy, readiness, fatigue management, psychological challenges, rare accomplishments).

Add an Achievement unlock popup system: when an achievement unlocks, show a smooth animated popup from center with bounce + fade, trophy 3D glow/soft shadows/subtle shine sweep, and particle flare on unlock. Play the specified reward sound effect (chime + pulse + subtle deep bass) using the existing SFX system and global volume control.

Create an Achievements cabinet/list UI: a scrollable achievements screen/section with filter controls (easy, medium, hard, legendary) and a trophy cabinet presentation. Each trophy item must support hover/focus glow and an interactive description panel (no freeform text input). Use the provided popup color direction for achievements UI elements: popup background #0b0f14, highlight #00f0ff, secondary glow #ffcc00.

Integrate navigation access to the Achievements UI without removing or rebuilding existing screens or bottom navigation. Add a route (e.g., /achievements) and a clear entry point from an existing screen (e.g., Analytics) via a button or card.

Meet the performance requirements for the upgraded rank badge and achievements visuals: all animations should remain smooth at ~60fps on typical mobile devices, use GPU-accelerated transforms where applicable, and optimize glow/blur layers to avoid noticeable lag.

Extend the offline data layer to persist a Coins system, Chest opening history, and a Card wallet/inventory locally on-device, without removing or rebuilding any existing offline stores (sessions, settings, quality, milestones, achievements).

Include coins balance, chest history, and card wallet/inventory in the existing manual export/import backup flow (the JSON file the user can store in Google Drive), preserving backwards compatibility with older backups that do not contain these fields.

Implement an offline Coins awarding system that automatically grants coins after: (a) saving a pull-up session, (b) detecting milestones, (c) streak changes/bonuses, and (d) achievements unlocking; coin rewards must be based on performance and must not require network access.

Add a coins balance UI to the Dashboard: show total coins in the top-right with an animated rolling counter and a subtle glow burst when the balance increases; keep the existing Dashboard layout, rank badge, orb, fatigue rings, streak flame, and psychological pressure feedback intact.

Create a Chest Shop section inside the existing Settings tab that displays: total coin balance, available chest options (Common, Rare, Epic) with their coin costs, and a history list of opened chests; do not remove or rebuild existing Settings sections (Volume Control, Daily Goal, Backup & Restore, Danger Zone).

Implement the chest purchase and opening interaction flow: tap a chest, confirm purchase, deduct coins immediately, then play a premium chest-opening animation (shake + glow) and reveal each card one by one (flip/slide) with highlight glow; store results automatically to the offline wallet and chest history.

Implement the exact independent probabilistic draw tables for each chest type (each card draw is independent; duplicates in the same chest are allowed) and ensure the number of card draws per chest matches the specification: Common (3), Rare (5), Epic (7).

Apply tier-based chest visual styling and effects that match the existing luxury cold aesthetic and app palette (#0b0f14 background, #00f0ff accents) while adding distinct tier identity: Common (bronze + soft glow), Rare (silver + shimmering aura), Epic (gold/amber + animated particles + aura sweep).

Extend the existing SFX system to support chest-related sounds and wire them into the chest flow: Common chest uses a soft metallic click, Rare uses a sparkle/jingle, Epic uses an epic deep pulse/bass + shimmer; additionally, play a per-card reveal sound and stronger unique feedback for high-value reveals (rare/epic moments).

Add subtle positive feedback animations and haptics when coins are awarded and when a chest is opened; add stronger feedback for special reveals (rare/epic/high-value cards), while preserving existing haptic patterns and gracefully degrading on devices without vibration support.

Keep all previous app functionality unchanged and compatible: wheel-only input UX, existing navigation/screens, hexagon ranks, orb energy animations, stickman volume system, achievements/milestones/quality overlays, psychological pressure feedback, and performance targets (smooth ~60fps).

Implement optional chest modifiers: (a) a chest streak bonus where opening multiple chests in a row increases chances for higher value cards, and (b) a daily first-chest bonus for the first chest opened each day that slightly increases chances for higher value outcomes; expose clear on/off controls within the Chest Shop section and ensure defaults are off unless otherwise specified.
